com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model

Class AnalyticsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model.AnalyticsManager

  • public class AnalyticsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that computes analytics given a model full of subscriptions.

      AnalyticsManager(SharedViewModel model)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void calculateAnalytics()
      Run the whole suite of analytics, where each method called will save a computed value to a field of this class.
      private void calculateMostCommonRecharge()
      Calculates the most common recharge frequency amongst all the subscriptions, and saves the number of months that is most commonly found.
      private void calculateMostExpensive()
      Calculates the most expensive subscription per year, and saves the name of that subscription along with the yearly cost of it.
      private void calculateRestDueThisMonth()
      Calculates the analytic for the total amount due during the rest of the current month.
      private void calculateTotalDueNextMonth()
      Calculates the analytic for the total amount due next month.
      private void calculateTotalDueYearly()
      Calculates the analytic for total amount due per year, which also finds the yearly total for subscriptions that aren't explicitly yearly.
      private void calculateTotalThisMonth()
      Calculates the analytic for total amount due in the current month.
      void createMonthlyBreakdown(int months)
      Create the category breakdown HashMap, and fill it with the values it needs pertaining to the length of the period passed in.
      java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<Category,java.lang.Double>> getBreakdownList()
      After a category breakdown has been generated, return a list of every value in the breakdown as key-value pairs, with the key being the Category object and the value being the total dollar amount of that category as a double.
      double getCostMostExpensive()
      Get the cost of the most expensive yearly subscription.
      int getMostCommonRecharge()
      Get the recharge frequency that is used most commonly, which will be the number of months between charges, or 0 if there are no subscriptions or no one frequency is the most common
      java.lang.String getNameMostExpensive()
      Get the name of the most expensive yearly subscription.
      double getRestDueThisMonth()
      Get the total dollar amount due for the rest of the current month
      double getTotalDueNextMonth()
      Get the total dollar amount due in the next month.
      double getTotalDueThisMonth()
      Get the total dollar amount due in the current month.
      double getTotalDueYearly()
      Get the total dollar amount of all subscriptions due during the upcoming year.
      void regenerateAnalytics()
      Run the suite of analytics again and update the internal values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnalyticsManager

        public AnalyticsManager(SharedViewModel model)
        Create the analytics manager and calculate the suite of analytics using the given model. This will also create a default breakdown using one month.
        Parameters:
        model - the model containing all subscription data

      • AnalyticsManager

        public AnalyticsManager(SharedViewModel model,
                        ZeroTimeCalendar zeroTimeCalendar)
        Create the analytics manager and calculate the suite of analytics using the given model. This will also create a default breakdown using one month.
        Parameters:
        model - the model containing all subscription data
        zeroTimeCalendar - a zero time calendar set to the date that should be considered today's date. This is primarily used for testing.

    • Method Detail

      • regenerateAnalytics

        public void regenerateAnalytics()
        Run the suite of analytics again and update the internal values.

      • createMonthlyBreakdown

        public void createMonthlyBreakdown(int months)
        Create the category breakdown HashMap, and fill it with the values it needs pertaining to the length of the period passed in. This will calculate how much is owed for each category over a period of several months, starting from the current month.
        Parameters:
        months - the amount of months (starting with this month) to look at into the future

      • getTotalDueThisMonth

        public double getTotalDueThisMonth()
        Get the total dollar amount due in the current month.
        Returns:
        the total due this month as a double

      • getRestDueThisMonth

        public double getRestDueThisMonth()
        Get the total dollar amount due for the rest of the current month
        Returns:
        the total due in the rest of the month as a double

      • getTotalDueNextMonth

        public double getTotalDueNextMonth()
        Get the total dollar amount due in the next month.
        Returns:
        the total due next month as a double

      • getTotalDueYearly

        public double getTotalDueYearly()
        Get the total dollar amount of all subscriptions due during the upcoming year.
        Returns:
        the total yearly due as a double

      • getCostMostExpensive

        public double getCostMostExpensive()
        Get the cost of the most expensive yearly subscription.
        Returns:
        the most expensive yearly cost as a double

      • getNameMostExpensive

        public java.lang.String getNameMostExpensive()
        Get the name of the most expensive yearly subscription.
        Returns:
        the name of the most expensive yearly subscription as a string

      • getMostCommonRecharge

        public int getMostCommonRecharge()
        Get the recharge frequency that is used most commonly, which will be the number of months between charges, or 0 if there are no subscriptions or no one frequency is the most common
        Returns:
        the most common number of months between charges as an integer

      • getBreakdownList

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<Category,java.lang.Double>> getBreakdownList()
        After a category breakdown has been generated, return a list of every value in the breakdown as key-value pairs, with the key being the Category object and the value being the total dollar amount of that category as a double. The list will be sorted with the highest amount being first.
        Returns:
        a sorted list of key-value pairs of categories and doubles

      • calculateAnalytics

        private void calculateAnalytics()
        Run the whole suite of analytics, where each method called will save a computed value to a field of this class.

      • calculateTotalThisMonth

        private void calculateTotalThisMonth()
        Calculates the analytic for total amount due in the current month.

      • calculateRestDueThisMonth

        private void calculateRestDueThisMonth()
        Calculates the analytic for the total amount due during the rest of the current month. If subscriptions were due earlier this month, but their date already passed, they are ignored here, this just counts ones with next payment dates still during the current month.

      • calculateTotalDueNextMonth

        private void calculateTotalDueNextMonth()
        Calculates the analytic for the total amount due next month.

      • calculateTotalDueYearly

        private void calculateTotalDueYearly()
        Calculates the analytic for total amount due per year, which also finds the yearly total for subscriptions that aren't explicitly yearly.

      • calculateMostExpensive

        private void calculateMostExpensive()
        Calculates the most expensive subscription per year, and saves the name of that subscription along with the yearly cost of it.

      • calculateMostCommonRecharge

        private void calculateMostCommonRecharge()
        Calculates the most common recharge frequency amongst all the subscriptions, and saves the number of months that is most commonly found. It will be 0 if there are no subscriptions or no one rate is the maximum.
